## GAD-7 vs UGDS

Comparing different psychological measurements like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Utrecht Gender Dysphoria Scale - Assigned Male at Birth (UGDS) can often be a daunting task for researchers. This is where a tool like Harmony comes in. Specifically designed for psychologists and social scientists, Harmony uses advanced technology to streamline the process of comparing and harmonizing these types of assessments. So, when looking at GAD-7 vs UGDS, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item, enabling efficient, clear comparisons and insight for further research. In the GAD-7 vs UGDS debate, Harmony takes center stage in bringing efficiency together with precision. With its expansive database and the option to upload custom instruments, the platform simplifies questionnaire harmonization. By leveraging artificial intelligence and natural language processing, Harmony can analyze questionnaires in various languages, thereby enabling global research compatibility. Whether you're working with GAD-7, UGDS, or any other scale, Harmony’s innovative approach makes the process less time-consuming and more accurate. Experience a new level of convenience when dealing with GAD-7 vs UGDS or any other comparatives thanks to Harmony. Offering a user-friendly interface and robust functionality, Harmony is designed to cater to the needs of psychological and social science researchers. By utilising Harmony’s technology, studying and interpreting GAD-7 vs UGDS becomes a more efficient and streamlined process. The Harmony tool truly represents a leap forward in research and its collaboration capabilities.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and UGDS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just UGDS into Harmony</a> - compare UGDS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
